description.narrative: The group will work with 100 women and their families on environmental awareness and pollution reduction; bettering health and nutrition with the addition of papaya, banana, dumur, spinach, and leafy greens; and replacing the use of chemical fertilizers with vermiculture compost. These women are from Jambuni, Kanadighi, Uska, and Sawpara village. These communities are surrounded by highly polluting stone crusher and mining companies, and community members suffer from increased rates of anemia, skin diseases, miscarriages, night blindness, and many social stigmas. The group will organize activities to select SHG (Self Help Groups) through Panchyet Pradhan; train on vegetable cultivation, bio fertilizers and vermiculture, and kitchen garden practices; decrease pollution and the use of plastics, and promote reforestation, and share information about the health of surrounding vegetation and forest in local newsletters, IEC materials, and media in Chennai. It aims to start kitchen gardens for 50 women headed households, create a nursery for 10 SHG, and develop a seed bin supported by rickshaw business.
